reviewText: THIS DVD IS EXCELLENT!MANSON'S THE #1 PERFORMER,AND HIS CONCERTS ARE #1!HE MOVES AROUND THE WHOLE STAGE BEAUTIFULLY!HE'S SO HYPNOTIC!THERE'S SOMETHING ABOUT HIM!HE HAD FIRE,AND SMOKE THROUGHOUT THE WHOLE CONCERT.AT CERTAIN TIMES THERE WERE DIFFERENT COLORED LIGHTS.HE WAS CONSTANTLY DOING DIFFERENT THINGS,AND CHANGING CLOTHES.HE WALKED ON HIS HIGH STILTS.HE STOOD ON A HIGH PLATFORM-MUCH HIGHER THAN HIS STILTS.HE'S TRULY A PHENOMINAL MAN!THERE'S A SECTION IN THIS DVD CALLED:"THE DEATH PARADE".IT'S ALSO EXCELLENT!IT SHOWS DIFFERENT CLIPPINGS OF CONCERTS,WHAT GOES ON BEFORE AND AFTER THE CONCERTS,WHERE THE CONCERTS ARE,THERE'S PLENTY OF CLIPPINGS WITH MANSON TALKING AND DOING DIFFERENT THINGS.HE'S A TRIP!MANSON AND HIS BAND WAS ALSO PARTYING WITH THE FANS BACKSTAGE.HE'S SO SPECIAL!HE TRULY IS MAJESTIC,IMPERIAL,EXTRAODINARY,REMARKABLE,AMAZING,ETC...YOU NEED TO GET THIS DVD!

Title: N/A

reviewText: Not AATCHB (Nine Inch Nails: Live) intense, but it is a different band of a different style. This DVD I think delivers just what it is supposed to and that is Marilyn at his best. He is a shaman of sorts to open our comatose eyes to reality. He puts on a rockin show. Being in 5.1 surround the sound quality is awesome and the picture is very clear. The concert captures all the best parts of each song performed with clear and smooth transitions, for the most part. I love the effects of his show and the feelings he brings out. At one point, he comes out on a black covered platform, I presume, and looks larger then life. On the "Nobodies", he performs in painter's stilts to highten his vision that he wants to share with you, a little part of his world. The 30 minute documentary, "The Death Parade", was enjoyable but I guess I was expecting a whole lot more. Personally I got a better view of the person and his life on the road on his "God is in the TV" video. But the poet put this together himself and showed us what he wanted. This DVD is trully a great accomplishment for Marilyn, a artist who never stops to amaze.

reviewText: Footages from different places around the world, from Japan to Russia, and not only in the US...pretty cool.  No reason to not own one for Marilyn Manson fans...and even those who aren't fans, perhaps you may see how Marilyn Manson is admired worldwide by people from even the most different cultures. reviewText: I can honestly say that I am not a big fan of Marilyn Manson's music but I do support his First Amendment right to speak as he pleases. With the said the Guns, God and Government World Tour of 1999-2001 was one of the controversial artists defining moments.The video was filmed all over the world so that we never get an actual show but a collage of several shows from all over the tour. I'm not a big fan of concert films that are put together this way but everyone can make their own decision on the merits of this approach.The film features 17 of Manson's songs including powerful versions of such classics as Disposable Teens, Beautiful People, The Dope Show, Sweet Dreams and Lunchbox. The band with the addition of new guitarist John 5 plays the music quite well.The disc features the concert and a 30 minute behind the scenes feature called THe Death Parade.

reviewText: I just recieved the VHS Video version of this Concert of Marilyn Manson, and I must say I am very dissapointed. I don;t have a DVD player, so I needed to get the VHS version of this show, and none of the extras was in the video. The Death Parade Documentary was not included, no behind the scenes stuff, backstage footage, nothing! Just a concert. The concert was good though- typical Marilyn Manson show, so that was GOOD, but what happened to all the behind the scenes stuff? Why was not The Death Parade documentary not included on the VHS version?Get "God is in the TV" or "Dead to The world" better.
Title: N/A

reviewText: That is correct, I am not a true Marilyn Manson Fan.  Portrait of an American Family was about the only MM album  I actually liked.  The rest spent to much time attempting to make this artist seem weird or maybe was an attempt to appear similar to certain Alice Cooper recordings.  When I first saw this DVD, I had accidentally checked it out from the local Library.  I do not recall what title I was reaching for but somehow this ended up in my stack.  So I got to see this video for free by accident.Although I still thought MM appeared to be a little strange in his on stage activities, he really seemed to get a rise out of the audience, and eventually even had a stagnant rocker like myself enjoying the show.  Although it may not have been as grand as seeing Kiss or Alice Cooper -- it did seem to fit into this same catagory.  I still think Rob Zombie is a much better artist than MM, but this concert is worth looking into.
summary: One of the best concert videos I have seen, and I am not a big MM Fan.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Marilyn Manson Live is a sight to behold.  His vocal range is intense and the band makes the songs that you love so much even more enjoyable.  Examples would be the end to Beautiful People or Sweet Dreams with the Hell Outro, it's just insane!  The only complaint that most people have is that it was filmed in multiple countries, the angle changes can get annoying.  I think the best example of that is the Irresponsible Hate Anthem.  It hurt my eyes the first time I watched that song, but most of the people who complain about it must understand this, I've been to a Manson show, and when they played it, the strobe lights went crazy, and here they try to replicate that, but it doesn't work quite as well.  The combination of strobe lights mixed with angle changes with every change in the song isn't necessarily the best thing.  Another complaint would be that because of the changes his clothes constantly change over and over again.  In one shot he has this helmet on and another he has a dress on or he has paint on him or in somewhat normal Goth clothes, I could go on forever.  But this DVD is so good, that I could care less about those things.Every song is played with amazing quality and sometimes better then the studio versions.  The props Manson brings out make it all the more interesting and never get you bored.  The audiences for these shows are absolutely HUGE by the way.  One of my favorite moments is during the love song Manson comes out wearing a pope outfit or something and John 5 plays a double guitar.  As with the song list, its great, its only missing Angel with the Scabbed wings and more songs from the portrait era, as they only play Lunchbox, I would love to see Dope Hat, but you can't have everything I suppose.  The death parade documentary was entertaining, disgusting an hilarious, but I felt it was too short or still missing some things.  but once again you can't have everything, that's why they make B-Sides.  All in all this is definitely worth the money and definitely worth your time.  If you haven't seen Manson live before this will convince you to.On an additional note, Amazon.com has misspelled government, look on the box itself and you will see it is spelled correctly.

Title: N/A

reviewText: First off, this is an excellent DVD. The music sounds great but only comes alive when played on a surround sound system or in your portable DVD player with earphones hooked up and the volume on maximum. Plus, the footage is very artistic in my opinion and I enjoyed seeing all the various concert footage from all over the world. I can't speak for everyone else but I can tell you what I think and leave it to you to decide whether you wanna buy it or not. It's worth a look, but make sure your DVD player is hooked up to a good surround sound stereo system.The whole effect will make you feel like you're actually there at the concert if you turn up the volume and start head banging.Marilyn Manson is my all-time favorite band, period. This DVD also contains an extra feature called "The Death Parade", which features 30 minutes of explicit & outrageous material, including: backstage footage of Manson following an incident in which he seriously tore a bloody hole on his knee, plus you get to see graphic footage of the deep wound being stitched up; Manson setting a hallway on fire; Clips of Manson & Eminem performing "The Way I Am"; Manson giving speeches, including one about a young girl who committed suicide & Marilyn Manson dedicates a song for her. There's also a hilarious clip of Manson calling a fan on stage after being hit with a water bottle by the stupid fan. Manson challanges the fan in a water bottle throwing showdown.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I bought this video a few weeks ago and it was O.K. But I wish I had gotten Marilyn Manson~God Is In the T.V. instead. This video is just a compilation of clips of Manson performing LIVE! infront of various crowds in various locations. If you've seen some of his other stuff then you've probably seen this one. However, it is very arty and the music is very clear. That's a good thing. And ofcourse, this video is not wholesome family entertainment. There's a scene in which Manson urines (!) on the stage. The video also contains nudity and strong language. But I still got a fair kick out of it. I'm not easily offended, so it didn't bother me the least bit. Christians are strongly advised to steer clear of this thing! Manson is the self-proclaimed "Antichrist Superstar", and I think that's cool!!!You should hear the speech that Manson gives during the credits at the end of the video. Manson actually reads from the bible! But not your typical serman. So be alert!!! Buy God Is In the T.V. I am planning on getting that one next time.

reviewText: "This will help you see what its like to be nailed to this wrecking ball" MARILYN MANSON.  Guns, God and Goverment is a rare look at one of the world's most controversial artist's lifestyle both on and off the stage.  Shot throughout the US, Japan, Russia and Europe this release spotlights the performance that has made MANSON truly infamous.  This DVD contains features wich gives the viewer an 'All Access Pass' to off stage life and a glimpse behind the scenes as the tour takes the from Tokyo to Berlin, Moscow to Rome, London to New York and everywhere between.  DVD bonus features:  'The Death Parade':  A 30 minute short film of the band's last trip around the world.  DVD audio options:  Stereo, 5.1, and DTS,  running time:  107 minutes approx.  By-far, the best live MANSON you will ever see or hear!

reviewText: This dvd is rather good, and instead of showing one straight show, they'll show the same song being proformed at different concerts.  Idea sound familiar?  It should if you've seen the Nine Inch Nails live DVD "And All That Could Have Been."  The difference is that NIN did it right, smooth transistions and even people who don't like Nails can enjoy the concert experiance.This DVD however is choppy almost to the point of it being unwatchable.  I understand the reason for showing 55 angles every 2 minutes, but then give us a brief rest!  In that respect, the NIN DVD is superior.Ignoring the angles/views (which can be done with our good friend alcohol), the proformance portions are absolutlely astounding.  What a stage presence, what a voice, and what a bassist.  From the "Irresponsible Hate Anthem" to "Lunchbox," the crowd is really into it and the music is great.  "The Death March," the quasi-documentary on this disk, is absolutely hilarious.Overall good, not great.  I liked it better when it was called "And All That Could Have Been."

reviewText: The Guns, God, and Government World Tour DVD highlights Marilyn Manson's tour around the world by piecing footage together for the 17 song set and also includes a rowdy and downright hilarious half hour documentary.  The live set nicely displays how great the stage shows are at a Manson concert; and the crowds respond with unabashed worship towards Manson and crew.  Standout songs include "Irresponsible Hate Anthem", "Great Big White World", "The Nobodies", "Rock is Dead", "Cruci-fiction in Space", "Sweet Dreams", and "Lunchbox".  The aforementioned documentary is a nice bonus, but for the price of this DVD, some other features could have been included, but all together this DVD is better than I thought it would be.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I've known of MM for a long time: from his beginnings of always playing a local club in the early days in RI (Club BabyHead) and his shows at Ozzfest, yet I always thought he was a bit silly.  He always, to me, looked like a character out of The nightmare before Christmas. Plus, I thought it was bizarre how he hit the mainstream by the popularity of recording a Erthymics cover, since his music was distinct and was a milestone of later 90's hard rock. Much of his stuff, I didn't like until the Mechanical Animals stuff.  Yet, I always loved that song LONG HARD ROAD OUT OF HELL from the Spawm Movie.  In fact, I like alot of MM songs from Soundtracks: Sweet Tooth, Tained Love (remake), and the 1st scene into. song to Blair Witch 2: Disposable teens...So,I figured I'd add this DVD to my collection.  I did see this show at Ozzfest so knew what I was getting.  This dvd is well made, the sound is great and I have grown to respect this guy alot as a musician and his crazy-cool lyrics.  Funny, tough, I laughed hysetericly at this concert during his performance of THE NOBODIES and still laught watching it on dvd.  I just think it's whacked him on those old circus stilts.  Anyways, this is a great dvd, MM took Goth to the next level and certainly has impacted music and style--something not done since...Madonna...I feel MM has grown as an artist and am actually looking forward to the release of his new cd EAT ME, DRINK ME in June 2007.
summary: After all this time MM is growing on me

reviewText: I'm giving this DVD four stars because the sound is good; it's excellent. I'll overlook the fact there are times he's singing, but the microphone ain't quite there. It's obvious Marilyn Manson puts on one hell of a show. This DVD is rockin', in that sense. Just remember, teeenie boppers, it's theatrics. Alice Cooper, Iggy Pop and others, in the late sixties and seventies, did this sh--. Manson ain't nothin' new. It ain't like Satananic theatrics are scary anymore. This DVD borders on a three star rating. It's just that he does put on one hell of a show.Marilyn just isn't all that and a bag of chips. His theatrics are good, but it's hard to take a man, in a thong like S&M; type outfit, seriously. Oh, when he supposedly pisses on himself is just so ridiculous. I'm sorry. Smellin' his butt with his fingers just gets comical.I still give it the four stars because I like his music, and this DVD sounds good.The editing takes numerous clips from numerous shows and combines them into one song. Sure it's well done, but it ticks me off when bands do this. Bad Religion did it; but, my lord, how much money does this band have and they release this kind of DVD? It annoys me.I probably should give this DVD three stars, but it does rock. You just have to get over the fact Marilyn looks like an idiot. He lacks that toughness to pull off the look, if that's possible. If he walked into a bar lookin' like he did with the thong leather pantie crap, a woman would kick his butt...You can reference a Guns 'n' Roses review of mine, I believe even Axyl Rose, in his cute little shorts, could kick Marilyn's butt...I know that wasn't politically correct, but it's true...Screw it, I should give it three stars, but the show is flippin' fun...
summary: I've got issues with this DVD, but hey....

reviewText: I love Manson and i was really looking forward to showing my friends who hadn't seen him live what they were missing. The combinations of the three shows in songs were really annoying and frustrated me very quickly. I want to see just one show like Korn-live, Nine Inch Nails - And All That Could Have Been, or Metallica's S&M where it showcases their energy and you see what their doing the whole time. What made up for this is the odd 30 minute documentary that was filled with backstage clips, interviews, and live footage. Overall i wouldn't recommend this DVD but to only the greatest Manson fans.

reviewText: HOLY FU*KING SH*T!!! (pardon my French) Can you say explicit!? The warning on the cover isn't nearly big enough. This DVD would probably burn up if holy water was cast on it... But I don't friggin' care! This is the best DVD ever! Despite what your local priest tells you, Manson Rocks! I would of enjoyed it more if it were from one whole concert instead of each song being cut from a different one. Theres a Hell of a lotta' explicit content on this DVD, In the extra "The Death Parade" 30 minute documentry. you'll see everything from Manson and Twiggy setting a dressing room on fire, to Manson getting John5 two chicks (im not quite sure if they were hookers) for his birthday (I personally prefered Daisy Berkowitz as a guitarist).Anyway... This footage is pretty good, Manson pulls down his pants showing his arse to the crowd (that may seem weird to you, but its awsome to me). In conclusion... If your a manson fan,GO FOR IT!!!, if your not a Manson fan, and not very open minded. Don't. If your under 13, and a Manson fan get it anyway... fin

I saw one of the first shows on this tour in Houston back in Nov 2000, and as always Mr. Manson did not disappoint me.  You can probably expect strange imagery, an original loading menu, and awesome special features with this one.  "If you die when there's no one watching, and your ratings drop and you're forgotten, if they kill you on their TV, you're a martyr and a Lamb of God."

reviewText: If you're looking for some real explicit and offensive language, messages and attitudes, you've reached gold...I wasn't a real Manson fan before I bought this DVD (I bought it because I wanted to know more about him), and now I must say I staret to enjoy some of his songs and attitudes.My personal favorite live performances are: "Rock Is Dead", "The Fight Song", "The Love Song" and "The Dope Show". They rock! Awesome songs!It's a full-screen show, and it's much better in 5.1 Surround...There is also a documentary called "The Death Parade", featuring Eminem and Ozzy Osbourne. It's about his tour repercussions. Involves religion, sex, death...The reason why I don't give this DVD a five or four stars is the same reason I gave this three stars: explicit content. The documentary "The Death Parade" contents really strong material for anyone under the age of 17 (here in Brazil, it's prohibited for anyone under the age of 18)... Sometimes it's even disgusting. And you'll get in this conclusion: Manson is absolutely insane.Do not ignore the "Explicit Content" label in the cover. Don't say you haven't been warned.
